title: Top Places to visit in Pakke Kessang, Lemmi, Arunachal Pradesh
content:
Pakke-Kessang is a town in the Indian state of Arunachal Pradesh. It is carved out of the East Kameng district along with five administrative units, namely Pakke-Kessang, Seijosa, Pijiriang, Passa Valley, and Dassing-Passo with district headquarters at Lemmi.

 

It is located 90 km north of the East Kameng district and is 190 km east of the State capital, Itanagar. Pakke-Kessang is one of the 60 constituencies of the Legislative Assembly of Arunachal Pradesh.

 

Pakke-Kessang consists of 10 villages and 10 panchayats. Naharlagun railway station, which is 180  km away from Pakke-Kessang district, is the nearest railway station.

Pakke-Kessang district is one of the 23 districts of Arunachal Pradesh state in India.

 

Pakke-Kessang (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is one of the 60 assembly constituencies of Arunachal Pradesh a north east state of India. Pakke-Kessang is part of Arunachal East Lok Sabha constituency.

 

sourcce: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakke-Kessang

recommendations.content:
Shi Yomi district is one of the 23 districts of Arunachal Pradesh state in northeastern India.
Arunachal Pradesh got its 23rd district on Sunday with the formal inauguration of Shi Yomi, carved out of the West Siang district, officials said.

recommendations.content: Anjaw District is an administrative district in the state of Arunachal Pradesh in north-east India.
